7/ Alternately, the valuation divided into $50B of reserves is a hefty 20% ‚Äì a very premium price. Further, the SPAC and fintech equity markets have been getting hammered for structural reasons, so this change is indeed surprising.

6/ Circle is going to continue to be one of the main drivers for retail and institutional adoption. Yet, the $9B valuation divided by the 10,000 expected number of accounts in 2022 gives a value of $900,000 an account.

5/ Most income is earned through transaction and treasury services (TTS). Circle Accounts and API services ‚Äì which now includes Circle Yield ‚Äì allows users to earn higher interest rates on idle cash balances and aiding their working capital requirements.

4/ Integrating with products like @solana's @phantom  wallet aligns with the strategy discussed in our prior Circle long take ‚Äì aggregating platforms for institutions & individuals bridging between traditional and blockchain rails to generate income through USDC transaction fees.
3/ The expansion of USDC can be partly attributed to their multi-chain integration on eight blockchains, including Solana and Avalanche.

2/ The SPAC was priced at $4.5B in July, but the new numbers are at double the value. This increase is due to the rapid growth of Circle‚Äôs stablecoin USDC, which has exhibited 13X growth from 2021 and on-chain transfers surpassing $1.8 trillion. This is behind only Tether‚Äôs USDT.

9/ In a similar vein in 2013, Jeff Bezos bought the Washington Post for $250 million. Arguably, Amazon‚Äôs biggest competitor is anti-monopoly regulation, and a voice close to power matters. For crypto, it‚Äôs still legitimacy and trust with the crowd.
8/ That‚Äôs not to say that Forbes is coopted in some sense, but that it might become a beacon to more crypto thought leadership and amplification.
7/ Forbes has the potential to bring a new swath of Web3 users and investments from the traditional sector, marrying crypto with the old money institutions and individuals.
6/ CZ is now in a position to shape the media narrative around crypto, as well as providing an outlet to test the myriad of Web3 tools disrupting the media industry.
5/ This year‚Äôs Super Bowl commercials have even led to it being dubbed the ‚ÄòCrypto Bowl‚Äô. We‚Äôll have more to say about this in a Long Take.

4/ Fun fact ‚Äî Binance‚Äôs CEO, @cz_binance  is on the Forbes rich list with a net worth of $96 billion (90% of Binance ownership), only five years after founding Binance.  This investment plays into the trend of crypto companies building out their brands with traditional media.
3/ @Forbes, soon to be listed on the NYSE as FRBS, reaches 150 million people through its content and events, and will be giving up two of their nine board seats to Binance following the move.

2/ The world‚Äôs largest crypto exchange, Binance, is now one of the top two owners in Forbes after making a $200 million strategic investment. The funds will account for half of the $400 million that Forbes had been planning to raise from institutional investors for their

8/ A recent survey suggests that retaining front-end customer experience is the main demand driver for embedded finance (85% of respondents), and that the market could grow to $7.2 trillion in enterprise value by 2030.
7/ For traditional brands, we are familiar with the demand for integration of financial services into the user‚Äôs digital experience -- called embedded finance
6/ But there‚Äôs also a lot of competition in the US, including well established public market players like Green Dot and The Bancorp.
5/ The acquisition of Wirecard UK in 2020 gave Railsbank card issuance technology ‚Äî without all that accounting fraud ‚Äî helping it launch a Credit Card-as-as-Service to US-based clients.
4/ The London-based fintech has two clear customer segments: (1) neobanks and (2) traditional brands. Neobanks are digital storefronts that need digital financial products, like banking and credit.
3/ We think of it as a regulatory crowbar opening up bank data and functionality to third parties (3PPs).

2/ @railsbank's offers a Banking-as-a-Service (BaaS) platform that builds APIs for entities who wish to offer financial products to their consumers and acts as a complete back-end solution for its clients.
